TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed SKAlphaType extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Describes how to interpret the alpha component of a pixel.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype SkiaSharp.SKAlphaType Opaque = int32(0)

Docs.summary: All pixels are stored as opaque.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype SkiaSharp.SKAlphaType Premul = int32(1)

summary.para: All pixels have their alpha premultiplied in their color components.
This is the natural format for the rendering target pixels.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype SkiaSharp.SKAlphaType Unpremul = int32(2)

summary.para: All pixels have their color components stored without any regard to the alpha. e.g. this is the default configuration for PNG images.
This alpha-type is ONLY supported for input images. Rendering cannot generate this on output.
